document.ModsDocTitle: Revision of the Agathidinae (Hymenoptera, Braconidae) of Vietnam, with the description of forty-two new species and three new genera
document.docAuthor: van Achterberg, Cornelis & Long, Khuat Dang
document.docTitle: Troticus alloflavus Achterberg & Long, 2010, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Agathidinae (Hymenoptera, Braconidae) of Vietnam, with the description of forty-two new species and three new genera

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Agathidinae (Hymenoptera, Braconidae) of Vietnam, with the description of forty-two new species and three new genera

subSubSection.paragraph: Holotype, ♀ (IEBR), Aga. 170, "S. Vietnam: Kien Giang, Phu Quoc N.P., 4.xii.2003, N.Th. Huong".
The colour pattern of this species seems to be unique in the genera Troticus and Disophrys , having the wings completely yellowish and having only a small isolated stigmal spot.
Holotype, ♀, length of body 16.0 mm, of fore wing 16.0 mm.

subSection.paragraph: Antennal segments 68, length of third segment subequal to fourth segment, length of third, fourth and penultimate segments 1.8, 2.0 and 1.2 times their width, respectively; apical antennal segment long conical, 2.6 times as long as penultimate segment; length of maxillary palp 0.7 times height of head; in dorsal view length of eye 1.3 times temple; temple gradually narrowed (Fig. 394); ocelli large, POL:OD:OOL = 10:9:24; face with dense distinct fine punctures; lateral carina of frons near antennal sockets (Fig. 394); pair of crests between antennal sockets slightly convergent; frons, vertex and temple smooth, sparsely setose.

Fore wing: second submarginal cell large, pentagonal, narrow anteriorly, without ramellus (Fig. 393); r:3-SR:SR1= 6:10:75; 2-SR:3-SR:r-m = 12:10:14. Hind wing: M+CU rather long, 0.8 times as long as 1-M (42:50); surroundings of cu-a densely setose.

Hind coxa rather long, hind femur robust, length of hind femur, tibia and basitarsus 4.0, 7.2 and 12.6 times their width, respectively; hind femur (as remainder of legs) with long and dense setosity; outer side of apex of hind tibia with two equal and distal each other pegs; length of outer and inner spurs of middle tibia 0.3 and 0.4 times middle basitarsus, respectively; length of outer and inner spurs of hind tibia 0.3 and 0.4 times hind basitarsus; fore and middle tarsi slender.

First tergite slender, smooth, slightly widened apically (Fig. 397); length of first tergite 1.5 times its apical width, slightly depressed laterally; second metasomal suture absent (Fig. 397), ovipositor sheath short conical, 0.2 times as long as inner hind tibial spur.
Yellow; antenna brown but scapus yellow, blackish ventrally; fore wing with isolated stigmal spot.

caption.paragraph: Figure 392. Troticus alloflavus sp. n., female, holotype. Habitus lateral.
Figures 393-397. Troticus alloflavus sp. n., female, holotype. 393 wings 394 head dorsal 395 head and mesosoma lateral 396 mesosoma dorsal 397 first-third metasomal tergites dorsal.

subSubSection.paragraph: From "allo" (Greek for "other" ), and "flavus" (Latin for "yellow" ), because of the different yellow colour pattern.
